content: The Louvre Museum, one of the world's largest art museums, is located in which European city?

The Louvre Museum is located in Paris, the capital city of France in Europe. The museum is housed in the Louvre Palace, which was originally built in the 12th century as a fortress. Over the years, the palace was expanded and modified, and in 1793, the Louvre was opened as a public museum. Today, it is one of the most visited museums in the world, attracting millions of visitors each year who come to see its vast collection of art and artifacts from around the globe.
